item.title: [317] Lotto [/317]
item.dc:creator: @_ZeroScape `ZeroScape
item.description:
@_ZeroScape wrote:

djdoyle1:

What’s with the apostrophe after read

I have no idea :o.

By the way - here is another small fix 

        public int lottoPrice = 100000;
        public int timeSinceLotto;
        public int played;
        public int serverOnlineTime;
        public int millisecondsToSeconds;
        public boolean printBatch = false;
		public int moneyAmount[] = { 1000000, 2000000, 3000000, 4000000, 5000000 };
        public int[] possibleRewards = { 5698, 4151, 1042, 1375, 995, 995, 995, 995 };
        
        public void lotto() {
                if (playerHasItemAmount(995, lottoPrice) == true) {
                        if (timeSinceLotto == 0) {
                                lottoPlayed = true;
                                deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), lottoPrice);
                                int number1 = misc.random(2);
                                int number2 = misc.random(2);
                                sM("Your number is: " + number1 + ", the computers number is: " + number2 + "!");
                                if (number1 == number2) {
                                        if (printBatch == true) {
                                                System.out.println(playerName + " played lotto, and won!");
                                        }
                                        sM("Congratulations! You won the lotto! Your reward is..");
                                        int rewardID = possibleRewards[(int) (Math.random()*possibleRewards.length)];
                                        int rewardAmount = 1;
                                        if (rewardID == 995) {
											rewardAmount = moneyAmount[misc.random2(5)];
                                        }
                                        addItem(rewardID, rewardAmount);
                                        sM("" + rewardAmount + "x " + getItemName(rewardID) + "!");
                                } else {
                                        sM("Awwww! You lost the game. Better luck next time!");
                                }
                        } else {
                                sM("You've already played lotto in the last 12 hours!");
                        }
                } else {
                        sM("Sorry! You must have at least 100,000gp to play lotto!");
                }
        }

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Lotto [/317]
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

[quote="`ZeroScape, post:13, topic:338397"]I fixed it for you, djdoyle1.

[code] // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
// - LottoFixed 1.0 by `ZeroScape - a fixed version of djdoyle1’s Lotto-system. -
// - Remember to give the credits to djdoyle1 for his ideas. Have fun =)! -
// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

public int lottoPrice = 100000;
public int timeSinceLotto;
public int played;
public int serverOnlineTime;
public int millisecondsToSeconds;
public boolean printBatch = false;
public int[] possibleRewards = { 5698, 4151, 1042, 1375, 995, 995, 995, 995 };

public void lotto() {
	if (playerHasItemAmount(995, lottoPrice) == true) {
		if (timeSinceLotto == 0) {
			lottoPlayed = true;
			deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), lottoPrice);
			int number1 = misc.random(2);
			int number2 = misc.random(2);
			sM("Your number is: " + number1 + ", the computers number is: " + number2 + "!");
			if (number1 == number2) {
				if (printBatch == true) {
					System.out.println(playerName + " played lotto, and won!");
				}
				sM("Congratulations! You won the lotto! Your reward is..");
				int rewardID = possibleRewards[(int) (Math.random()*possibleRewards.length)];
				int rewardAmount = 1;
				if (rewardID == 995) {
					int GpRandomize = misc.random(4);
					if (GpRandomize == 0) {
						rewardAmount = 1000000;
					}
					if (GpRandomize == 1) {
						rewardAmount = 2000000;
					}		
					if (GpRandomize == 2) {
						rewardAmount = 3000000;
					}
					if (GpRandomize == 3) {
						rewardAmount = 4000000;
					}
					if (GpRandomize == 4) {
						rewardAmount = 5000000;
					}		
				}
				addItem(rewardID, rewardAmount);
				sM("" + rewardAmount + "x " + getItemName(rewardID) + "!");
			} else {
				sM("Awwww! You lost the game. Better luck next time!");
			}
		} else {
			sM("You've already played lotto in the last 12 hours!");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Sorry! You must have at least 100,000gp to play lotto!");
	}
}[/code]

This fixed method should be confirtable to run with your system ;)…[/quote]
You need atleast 40% for that

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Lotto [/317]
item.dc:creator: @_ZeroScape `ZeroScape
item.description:
@_ZeroScape wrote:

I fixed it for you, djdoyle1.

[code] // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
// - LottoFixed 1.0 by `ZeroScape - a fixed version of djdoyle1’s Lotto-system. -
// - Remember to give the credits to djdoyle1 for his ideas. Have fun =)! -
// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

public int lottoPrice = 100000;
public int timeSinceLotto;
public int played;
public int serverOnlineTime;
public int millisecondsToSeconds;
public boolean printBatch = false;
public int[] possibleRewards = { 5698, 4151, 1042, 1375, 995, 995, 995, 995 };

public void lotto() {
	if (playerHasItemAmount(995, lottoPrice) == true) {
		if (timeSinceLotto == 0) {
			lottoPlayed = true;
			deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), lottoPrice);
			int number1 = misc.random(2);
			int number2 = misc.random(2);
			sM("Your number is: " + number1 + ", the computers number is: " + number2 + "!");
			if (number1 == number2) {
				if (printBatch == true) {
					System.out.println(playerName + " played lotto, and won!");
				}
				sM("Congratulations! You won the lotto! Your reward is..");
				int rewardID = possibleRewards[(int) (Math.random()*possibleRewards.length)];
				int rewardAmount = 1;
				if (rewardID == 995) {
					int GpRandomize = misc.random(4);
					if (GpRandomize == 0) {
						rewardAmount = 1000000;
					}
					if (GpRandomize == 1) {
						rewardAmount = 2000000;
					}		
					if (GpRandomize == 2) {
						rewardAmount = 3000000;
					}
					if (GpRandomize == 3) {
						rewardAmount = 4000000;
					}
					if (GpRandomize == 4) {
						rewardAmount = 5000000;
					}		
				}
				addItem(rewardID, rewardAmount);
				sM("" + rewardAmount + "x " + getItemName(rewardID) + "!");
			} else {
				sM("Awwww! You lost the game. Better luck next time!");
			}
		} else {
			sM("You've already played lotto in the last 12 hours!");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Sorry! You must have at least 100,000gp to play lotto!");
	}
}[/code]

This fixed method should be confirtable to run with your system ;)…

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Lotto [/317]
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

you made a lottery confusing, lol. I made my own Gamble Command, basic and yet worked.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("gamble")) {
if(!playerHasItem(995, 50000000)) {
sM("Make sure you have 50M cash in your inventory first.");
} else {
deleteItem(995, 50000000);
addItem(Item.randomgamble(), 1);
sM("You gamble your money!");
}
}

Then I just added the randomgamble in my item.java and it randomly gives 1 of the items.
